sndlib.core.problem
Class RoutingPath

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.problem.RoutingPath

public class RoutingPath
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a routing path in a specific solution of a network design problem.

A RoutingPath is simply a sequence of RoutingLinks, where every RoutingLink, beside its referenced network Link, also comprises the direction into which the link is traversed. A common use of this class is to check the existence of given path in a network.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
SolvedProblem

Method Detail

newUndirectedSTPath

public static RoutingPath newUndirectedSTPath(java.util.List<Link> links,
                                              Node source,
                                              Node target)
Constructs a routing path from the specified source to the specified target node. The path is built from the given list of links. The links are assumed to be undirected.

Parameters:
links - the links on the path
source - the source node of the path
target - the target node of the path
Returns:
a routing path from source to target consisting of the given links; null if there is no undirected path from source to target

newDirectedSTPath

public static RoutingPath newDirectedSTPath(java.util.List<Link> links,
                                            Node source,
                                            Node target)
Constructs a routing path from the specified source to the specified target node. The path is built from the given list of links. The links are assumed to be directed.

Parameters:
links - the links on the path
source - the source node of the path
target - the target node of the path
Returns:
a routing path from source to target consisting of the given links; null if there is no directed path from source to target

newUndirectedSTOrTSPath

public static RoutingPath newUndirectedSTOrTSPath(java.util.List<Link> links,
                                                  Node one,
                                                  Node other)
Constructs a routing path between the specified nodes, disregarding which of them is the source and which is the target node. The path is built from the given list of links. The links are assumed to be undirected.

Parameters:
links - the links on the path
one - the one end of the path
other - the other end of the path
Returns:
a routing path consisting of the given links between the specified nodes; null if there is no undirected path between the specified nodes

newDirectedSTOrTSPath

                                                Node one,
                                                Node another)
Constructs a routing path between the specified nodes, disregarding which of them is the source and which is the target node. The path is built from the given list of links. The links are assumed to be directed.

Parameters:
links - the links on the path
one - the one end of the path
another - the other end of the path
Returns:
a routing path consisting of the given links between the specified nodes; null if there is no directed path between the specified nodes

getBuilderFor

public static RoutingPath.Builder getBuilderFor(LinkModel linkModel,
                                                DemandModel demandModel)
Returns the appropriate builder for the specified link and demand model.

If the link model is DIRECTED then the links are assumed to be directed. Otherwise it is assumed that they can be traversed in both directions. If the demand model is DIRECTED then there must be a definite source and target node. Otherwise the path is assumed to be valid in both directions.

Parameters:
linkModel - the link model
demandModel - the demand model
Returns:
the appropriate builder for the given link and demand model

routingLinks

public java.util.List<RoutingLink> routingLinks()
Returns a List view of the routing links this routing path.

The returned list is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the list will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable list view of the routing links in this routing path

getLast

public RoutingLink getLast()
Returns the last routing link in this routing path.

Returns:
the last routing link

getFirst

public RoutingLink getFirst()
Returns the first routing link in this routing path.

Returns:
the first routing link
